result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections. To pay $480 to Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. Must report to jail by 1/02/15.

Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State makes joint sentencing recommendation. Atty Gerbers makes some minor corrections to PSI, makes joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Defendants employer, Richard Wegner makes statement on defendants behalf.  Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers meeting with defendant tomorrow to go over discovery material, requests one more adjournment. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers needs to figure out the history of the case, requests time to talk to ADA Korb about possible resolution. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Change of attorney
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Maciolek advises he may have a conflict, depends on who the CI is. Atty Maciolek will have new counsel appointed if there is a conflict. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains as is.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Shawn A Martinson in court with attorney Carrie LaPlant.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty LaPlant indicates defendant qualifies for PD representation, counsel will be appointed to represent defendant. State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
